alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 03 at 6:26AM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Gusty southerly winds return on Monday to NorCal... .Southerly winds will increase on today across interior northern California. The strongest winds in the Valley will be concentrated in the central and northern Sacramento Valley, extending into the adjacent Sierra foothills. Winds will begin to subside late tonight or early Tuesday morning. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 35 to 45 mph. Local gusts near 50 mph possible. * WHERE...Portions of the northern Sacramento Valley, Central Sacramento Valley, and the eastern foothills of Shasta, Tehama and Butte Counties. This includes the cities of Redding, Red Bluff, and Chico. * WHEN...From 7 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few local power outages may result. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley
